titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Hacher, William Hacher, Richard Bennet, & Arch Cavenagh, Indictment
CWG7379

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Owsly Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Indictment
Tho Hacher William Hacher Richard Bennet & Arch Cavenagh

The Grand Jury of owsly county in the name and by the authority of the commwlth of Kentucky Accuse Tho Hacher William Hacher Richard Bennett & Arch Cavenaugh of the crime of Robbery committed as follows viz the said Tho Hacher William Hacher Richard Bennett & Arch Canvennaugh did in the county aforesaid on the 30 day of November 1865 Feloniously Forcibly and by puting Henry Moore in feer take from said Henry Moore against his will Two horses the property of and in the passion of the said Moore of the value of Two hundred Dollrs and against the peace & dignity of the commonwealth of kentucky

H F Finly Comwlth atty
Witness
Henry Moore
Filed 4 Nov 1865
A Copy attest
A B McGuire c o c c
